relatedBlades.htmlContent: Cloudflare named in 2024 Gartner Magic Quadrant for SV-SASE. Announcement >

relatedBlades.title: Secure Third Party Access
relatedBlades.subtitle: Give third party collaborators a first class experience, with fast and safe access to applications
relatedBlades.copy: Providing application access to collaborators outside your organization  whether they're contract workers, agencies, or partner organizations  can be a security risk and a logistical headache. Learn how Cloudflare Access makes connecting 3rd party users to  workforce apps secure and simple.

image.description: Illustration of an identity with icons of identity providers

contentfulAsset.description: Illustration of an identity with icons of identity providers

relatedBlades.title: Challenges with third party access management

features.title: Excessive privilege brings excessive risks
features.description: Collaborators often need to reach a few critical applications to get their job done. Yet they tend to accrue excessive privileges over time. This excessive privilege can introduce risk.

features.title: Onerous to manage
features.description: Onboarding external users is often time-consuming and expensive. Many organizations pay for SSO licenses for contractors, and have to manage their access separately.

features.title: Slower productivity onramp
features.description: Because it's harder to manage their access, contractors end up wasting hours or days waiting for the tools they need.

relatedBlades.title: The challenge of sharing identity sources
relatedBlades.copy: If your team has an application that you need to share with partners or contractors, both parties need to agree on a source of identity. Some teams opt to solve that challenge by onboarding external users to their own identity provider. When contractors join a project, the IT department receives help desk tickets to create new user accounts in the organization directory. Contractors receive instructions on how to sign-up. They spend time creating passwords and learning the new tool, and then use those credentials to login.

relatedBlades.title: Multi-SSO with Cloudflare Access
relatedBlades.copy: Access allows you to use multiple sources of identity to grant different groups of users access to the same application. Thisgives you the flexibility to extend access to external users (3rd parties, contractors, vendors) without having to onboard them onto your centralized Identity Provider.

relatedBlades.title: Manage third party access confidently with Zero Trust access
relatedBlades.copy: Cloudflare Access delivers [Zero Trust access](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/access-management/what-is-ztna/) for third party collaborators, helping you enforce least privilege across all applications without additional overhead.

features.title: Implement least-privilege access
features.description: Reduce risk by implementing app-specific, Zero Trust access scoped to users.

features.title: Onboard and offboard faster
features.description: No need to deploy a VPN or ship a corporate device to get users started. 3rd party users can authenticate to applications with a familiar login flow.

features.title: Reduce identity and access management spend
features.description: Support for multiple identity providers means you can give 3rd party users access without having to provision  SSO licenses.

relatedBlades.title: Integrate multiple identity providers
relatedBlades.copy: Your contractors can bring their own existing identities from LinkedIn, GitHub, Google or other providers for seamless login. IT teams save time and resources by keeping contractors out of the corporate identity tenant. Security gains peace of mind knowing third-party users have narrowly scoped permissions.

imageAssetFile.altText: Screenshot of Cloudflare for Teams dashboard on identity providers screen.
imageAssetFile.title: VPN Replacement - Multiple Identity Provider

relatedBlades.title: Time-based OTPs for authentication
relatedBlades.copy: Guest users can authenticate with time-based one-time passwords based on user email addresses.

relatedBlades.title: Granular access policies
relatedBlades.copy: Adopt [Zero Trust](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/security/glossary/what-is-zero-trust/) best practices by applying least privilege: Only provide your partners access to the apps they need to be successful and eliminate the unnecessary risks of granting permissions for apps they won't even use.

imageAssetFile.altText: Screenshot of the Cloudflare for Teams dashboard's location configuration screen.
imageAssetFile.title: Location

relatedBlades.title: Monitor user access and change logs
relatedBlades.copy: View and search real-time access logs in the dashboard or send to a third party SIEM for analysis. Full visibility across your contractor activity enables auditing and helps your organization manage its security more proactively.

imageAssetFile.altText: Screenshot of Cloudflare for Teams user activity logs list.
imageAssetFile.title: Third Party Access

relatedBlades.title: Helping organizations worldwide progress towards Zero Trust

relatedBlades.title: Start Now
relatedBlades.copy: Secure access to your corporate applications without a VPN. Getting started with Access takes minutes. With our free plan, your first 50 users are free.
